Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of VTE Prophylaxis and Persistent Wound Drainage After Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Two hospitals were randomized to administer aspirin (100 mg daily) or enoxaparin (40 mg daily)

Participants.evidence: Between April 2019 and December 2020, 1339 of 1679 eligible patients were included

Intervention.evidence: Two hospitals were randomized to administer aspirin (100 mg daily) or enoxaparin (40 mg daily)

Objective.evidence: This study examines the association between VTE prophylaxis type (enoxaparin vs. aspirin) and persistent wound drainage

Method_Outcome.evidence: Persistent wound drainage was defined as drainage beyond Postoperative Day 3

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between April 2019 and December 2020, 1339 of 1679 eligible patients were included

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in persistent wound drainage was found between enoxaparin (9%) and aspirin (8%) groups (OR 1.2, 95% CI 0.8 to 1.8; p = 0.40)
